sections.title: You cannot register the business for Fuel Duty

fields.label: cannotReg
fields.infoText:
This is because you need to enter the business' Economic Operator Registration and Identification (EORI) number.

You'll need to sign out, or save your progress and come back when you have the number. 

If you do not have an EORI number you'll need to go to GOV.UK to apply for one (https://www.gov.uk/eori).

declarationSection.title: Submit form to register the business for Fuel Duty

fields.infoText: By submitting this form you are confirming that all the information youâ€™ve provided is correct and complete.
This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted registration.
Your guarantor must also complete the VAT: deferment schedule - Simplified Import VAT Accounting reduced security (SIVA2) form (opens in a new window). They must then send it to HMRC.

You will need to contact HMRC if you do not use a weighbridge at one or more of your sites (to agree an alternative method for weighing materials).

If you have registered any sites without environmental permits you must also contact us when the permits have been granted (or if they are refused). 

[Contact details](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs/contact/landfill-tax) for Landfill Tax enquiries are available on GOV.UK or you can email, enquiries.eeitts@hmrc.gsi.gov.uk

If your business is a partnership you must also complete form LT2 to complete your registration. You can access this from [the guidance page for this service](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/landfill-tax-register-and-change-your-details) on GOV.UK.
